text:
Q: marginaleffects and future: global size exceeded A:

I think from future 1.40.0 you need to set the limit in the plan:

plan(multicore, workers = 8, maxSizeOfObjects = 10e9)

But I will wait for more knowledgeable persons to answer

Q: Dynamically display values on a ribbon chart controlled by a slicer A:

Thanks for noticing that. I didn't copy and paste from my report, I manually added it to this question. The code in the report doesn't have those typos.

Q: hang in printf on Windows A:

@mksteve answered in the comments - the issue here is that some text gets selected in the cmd window when the program runs. Focusing on the cmd window and pressing Esc fixes the issue

Q: pyDatalog: NameError when asserting a predicate from within a Python loop A:

Declare all terms, predicates and variables:

pyDatalog.create_terms('Flagged, X, Y')

Else, use dynamic assertion:

for row_idx in range(x):
    for col_idx in range(y):
        if grid[row_idx][col_idx] > t:variable
            pyDatalog.assert_fact('Flagged', row_idx, col_idx)
